text: The National Economic Council (NEC) of the United States is the principal forum used by the President of the United States for considering economic policy matters, separate from matters relating to domestic policy, which are the domain of the Domestic Policy Council. ==Directors of the National Economic Council== Officeholder Term start Term end President Robert Rubin January 25, 1993 January 11, 1995 Bill Clinton Laura Tyson February 21, 1995 December 12, 1996 Bill Clinton Gene Sperling December 12, 1996 January 20, 2001 Bill Clinton Lawrence B. Lindsey January 20, 2001 December 12, 2002 George W. Bush Stephen Friedman December 12, 2002 January 10, 2005 George W. Bush Allan B. Hubbard January 10, 2005 November 28, 2007 George W. Bush Keith Hennessey November 28, 2007 January 20, 2009 George W. Bush Lawrence Summers January 20, 2009 December 31, 2010 Barack Obama Gene Sperling January 20, 2011 March 5, 2014 Barack Obama Jeffrey Zients March 5, 2014 January 20, 2017 Barack Obama Gary Cohn January 20, 2017 April 2, 2018 Donald Trump Larry Kudlow April 2, 2018 January 20, 2021 Donald Trump Brian Deese January 20, 2021 February 21, 2023 Joe Biden Lael Brainard February 21, 2023 January 20, 2025 Joe Biden Kevin Hassett January 20, 2025 Donald Trump ==References== ==Other websites== *National Economic Council Category:Executive branch of the United States government *
title: United States National Economic Council
